required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Diagnosis and Human Growth Hormone Treatment in Small for Gestational Age Children With Short Stature
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Diagnosis and the Response to Recombinant Human Growth Hormone Treatment in Small for Gestational Age Children With Short Stature

collaborator.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University
The Children's Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine
Chengdu Women's and Children's Central Hospital
West China Second University Hospital, Sichuan University
The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a multi-center, retrospective and non-interventional research. In this study, a total of 150 short children who were small for gestational age and had been treated with recombinant human growth hormone (rhGH) are selected for genetic testing. The aims of this study are to analyze the genetic etiology of SGA children with short stature, and to compare the efficacy and safety of rhGH treatment in subjects with different etiologies.

primary_outcome.description: To detect the disease-causing genes of SGA children with short stature

arm_group.arm_group_label: short stature children born small for gestational age
arm_group.description: This group was defined as a group of children whose birth weight and/or birth length equal or less than -2 SD for sex and gestational age, and who had failed to catch up in growth, remaining short after 2 years old.

intervention.description: Genetic tests in this study are sequential testing, including MS-MLPA, whole exome sequencing, whole genome sequencing, as well as RNA-seq.
intervention.arm_group_label: short stature children born small for gestational age

responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of Endocrinology, Genetics and Metabolism
